document_title: Ureteral stones: Causes, signs and treatments
subsection_content: Pain: When the stone moves from the kidney to the ureter, the patient will feel pain in the kidney with symptoms such as sudden pain, severe pain, and pain from the waist spreading to the groin. .; Painful urination, frequent urination, cloudy urination: Patients may experience frequent urination and painful urination. Urine color is cloudy, pus appears (a sign of reverse kidney infection if there is fever with chills). This symptom seriously threatens kidney function. Patients are at risk of sepsis and septic shock; Hematuria: Stones can rub against the ureter wall, causing bleeding, leading to hematuria.; In some rare cases, small stones may be emitted.; Accompanying symptoms may occur such as fever, chills, nausea, abdominal distension, and bowel obstruction.
subsection_title: soi nieu quan.json. Signs of ureteral stone disease
subsection_data:
soi nieu quan.json. Signs of ureteral stone disease
Pain: When the stone moves from the kidney to the ureter, the patient will feel pain in the kidney with symptoms such as sudden pain, severe pain, and pain from the waist spreading to the groin. .; Painful urination, frequent urination, cloudy urination: Patients may experience frequent urination and painful urination. Urine color is cloudy, pus appears (a sign of reverse kidney infection if there is fever with chills). This symptom seriously threatens kidney function. Patients are at risk of sepsis and septic shock; Hematuria: Stones can rub against the ureter wall, causing bleeding, leading to hematuria.; In some rare cases, small stones may be emitted.; Accompanying symptoms may occur such as fever, chills, nausea, abdominal distension, and bowel obstruction.
